basics.name: Emillia E. Noordhoek
basics.summary: I'm a seasoned business development professional on a mission to help an early stage green startup profit and thrive.

work.summary: Helping to strengthen and launch community-driven and volunteer-powered projects; develop, and adopt meaningful community engagement strategies, and harness the power of the social web for social good. This work is guided by 13 years of prior experience working with community-based economic, environmental and energy initiatives in the Hawaiian Islands
highlights: Consulting and stewarding emergency funding applications for green startups and non-profits in current COVID-19 crisis on available Small Business Association (SBA) emergency financial products.
Developed the content for community meetings and evaluated outcomes creating an inculsive decisoin making procress for the Community Renewable Energy Project.
Co-founded the Tentou Network, a green business consortium  of global leaders following in the footsteps of 100% Renewable Energy Samso Island, Denmark.

work.summary: Built a financially sustainable organization from the ground up through creative fundraising, grant writing, and donor development; increased the annual budget 100% to $1,000,000 by the end of my tenure.
highlights: Pioneered sustainable financial models for Hawaii tourists to offset carbon footprint for travel.

Executed daily organizational operations including annual budget, program implementation;community relations and organizing; program evaluation; staff and management of 6-10 team members, 30 + volunteers.
Identified industry trends and shifts. Adjusted to acquire growth while retaining our organizational values.
Collaborated with and nurtured partnerships with high net worth donors.
Secured $9.6 million USD in public financing through the Hawaii Green Infrastructure Authority to provide revolving loans for 1,200 homes to participate in solar programs.

work.summary: Capitalized on the mission to build sustainable affordable housing by forming new business and brand partnerships, increasing annual budget to < $1.5 million
highlights: Coordinated project feasibility, developed and managed project budgets, secured $1.2 million in project financing from private and public sources pivoting focus to energy efficiency and solar.
Underwrote 15- 30 year mortgage at 0% interest that were held by local affiliate for the life of the loan.
Developed, coordinated, monitored and Evaluated all aspects of the Global Village Program into a vibrant and dynamic, growing income stream generating well over $100,000 USD annually.
Founding architect of community based art center, developed sustainable financial infrastructure, art and residency programs, and dynamic annual fundraisers.

education.institution: Portland State University, School of Urban Planning,

awards.title: Omidyar Fellowship-Forum of Fellows
awards.summary: Omidyar Fellows is an enduring and ongoing commitment to an active network of leaders and change-makers.

awards.title: Hawai’i Investment Ready-Cohort III
awards.summary: HIR is a two-year program designed for social ventures to better understand and scale their impact and business models, to implement their next level of growth.

awards.title: Hawai’i Alliance for Progressive Action
awards.summary: The core of HAPA’s mission is to catalyze community empowerment and systemic change - a change that goes to the root of our social, economic and environmental injustices.

publications.name: Molokai Agriculture Assessment
publications.summary: Lead writer and researcher for the Molokai Agriculture Needs Assessment.

publications.name: Molokai Energy Assessment
publications.summary: Lead researcher and academic oversight for the Molokai Energy Assessment.

skills.name: Business Development
keywords: Developing business plans and partnerships; PowerPoint, KeyNote and dynamic public speaking; policy development; sustainable building management; bold investment and financing credentials; marketing and communications planning.

skills.name: Non-Profit Management
keywords: Program and donor development;grant writing; developed strategy for sustainable living policies; volunteer recruitment; incorporating community volunteers into programmatic work; mentoring local youth interns.

skills.name: Loan Specialist
keywords: 10 years as a residential and commercial loan specialist with products such as FHA, VA, Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, including drawing loan documents, closing and funding. Most recently built an expertise in small business and non-profit revolving loan products specifically for renewable energy and climate mitigation projects.

skills.name: Software Development
keywords: WordPress, HTML, CLI, Git, JSON, VS Code

interests.name: Reforestation, American politics, renewable energy, green building designs, triathlons, dogs, pottery, wood-fired oven design and construction.
